title: Documentation-Implementation Synchronization Challenge
description: Learning from significant misalignment between documented project status and actual implementation progress

context.situation: Comprehensive audit revealed project was 95% complete in Phase 1 (not 85% as documented) and 60% complete in Phase 2 (not just planned)
context.impact: Risk of inaccurate status reporting, poor handoffs, and misaligned development priorities

discrepancies.actual: Fully deployed and operational with live Supabase instance

rootCauses: Implementation proceeded faster than documentation updates
No automated mechanism to verify documentation against codebase
Manual status tracking prone to human oversight
Focus on development over documentation maintenance

insights: Documentation can become outdated quickly during rapid development phases
Code-based evidence should be required for marking tasks as complete
Regular audits of documentation vs implementation status are critical
Automated tooling could help maintain documentation-implementation alignment

recommendations.action: Require code-based evidence when updating task status
recommendations.implementation: Link to deployed features, committed code, or live instances

recommendations.mechanism: Git hooks or CI/CD integration to prompt documentation updates

recommendations.timing: Before major handoffs, releases, or phase transitions

mitigationActions.immediate: Complete comprehensive documentation update to reflect actual implementation status
mitigationActions.longTerm: Implement automated tooling for documentation synchronization
